result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Terrus Jamal Clark appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Terrus Jamal Clark.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a final pre-trial.  State filed a Notice of Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial scheduled for November 7, 2022.  Court vacates jury trial and schedules a status conference.  Court ordered defendant REINSTATED to Justice Point for LEVEL 3 SUPERVISION.  All previously ordered conditions of bail remain in effect.  Zoom appearances approved by the Court at the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Terrus Jamal Clark in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Officer C. George. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Defendant Terrus Jamal Clark in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Terrus Jamal Clark in court with attorney David Thomas Conley.  Defendant Terrus Jamal Clark in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Terrus Jamal Clark appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
